abstract: DNA tests confirm that pair of human legs found in plastic bag near Connecticut train station belong to Ray Roberson, homeless man who was last seen alive on May 20; detectives have yet to determine motive or identity of any suspects.
lead_paragraph: DNA tests determined that a pair of human legs found in a plastic bag by a train station in Connecticut belonged to a 54-year-old homeless man who was last seen alive on May 20.

headline.main: Police Identify Man Whose Severed Legs Were Found in New Haven
headline.print_headline: Police Identify Man Whose Legs Were Found Near Train Station

snippet: DNA tests determined that a pair of human legs found in a plastic bag by a train station in Connecticut belonged to a 54-year-old homeless man who was last seen alive on May 20.
